page.title: 19CROP DISTRIBUTION.
page.content: Of the 108 whole or part, distinct, fields in our allocated block, 5 were devoted to pasture of either permanent or temporary type. The remainder were equally divided between the growing of wheat, barley and oil seed rape. The fields that are under pasture are either in areas that are badly drained or where they are close to the stables or housing. Some of the fields are devoted to the growing of plants for gardens, but these are only those right next to the garden centres. Many of the field boundaries have been removed to make it easier for the farmers to get their tractors across their land. Most of the boundaries dividing the roads from the fields still exist however and contain many wild flowers, the numbers of species of which are low at the moment due to recent council spraying policies.
